required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ocular Signs and Symptoms in Glaucoma Patients Switched From Latanoprost to Preservative Free Tafluprost Eye Drops
clinical_study.official_title: Ocular Signs and Symptoms in Patients With Ocular Hypertension or Open-angle Glaucoma Switched From Preserved Latanoprost 0.005% Eye Drops to Preservative Free Tafluprost Eye Drops

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate if changes in ocular signs and symptoms occur in patients with ocular hypertension or glaucoma when they switch from latanoprost 0.005% (Xalatan) to preservative free Tafluprost eye drops.

primary_outcome.measure: Assessment of changes in ocular symptoms and signs
primary_outcome.description: Ocular symptoms include: irritation/burning/stinging, foreign body sensation, tearing, itching and dry eye sensation. Following signs will be evaluated: tear break-up time, corneal and conjunctival fluorescein staining, blepharitis, conjunctival redness and tear secretion (schirmer test).

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary outcome measures include the assessment of safety and quality of life parameters.
secondary_outcome.description: Safety parameters include: best-corrected visual acuity, biomicroscopy, ophthalmoscopy, visual field test, drop discomfort upon instillation, intra ocular pressure, quality of life and adverse events.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a diagnosis of ocular hypertension or open angle glaucoma for which the patient has been using latanoprost 0.005% as his/her prior medication.
- Evaluable patients must have ocular surface related symptoms and/or signs with their prior medication.

overall_official.affiliation: State Educational Establishment of Higher Professional Education "Russian State Medical University of Federal Service on Surveillance in Healthcare and Social Development of Russian Federation"
